intro: Grumilea blepharostipula, commonly known as the broad-leafed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant belonging to the family Viscaraceae. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves, which are typically broad and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its berries are fleshy and contain a single seed, which is dispersed by birds. Grumilea blepharostipula typically grows on the branches of host trees, drawing water and nutrients from them while performing photosynthesis.
